title.rendered: Spock V0.2 — What’s new & what’s coming?

content.rendered:
The 0.1 version of Spock launched last week on Ethereum. Since then, we have received good feedback from our users on which kinds of feature they would like to see in future iterations. Today we announce the release of the 0.2 version of Spock with several new features, improvements, and minor bugs fixes.

What's New:

  1. Added support of Rinkeby testnet.
  2. Added support for the current TVL of dApps.
  3. Added count in Wallet Journey steps.
  4. Added TVL contribution in the last week.

What’s Improved:

  1. Added support for more outbound links.
  2. Improved general user experience.
  3. Improved color classification of Holders feature.
  4. Refactored the whole app to improve the quality of code.
  5. Made improvements to data filtering.

What’s Fixed:

  1. Fixed TVL removal graph.
  2. Fixed categorization of a wallet as dropped.

What’s Next:

We have exciting new features planned for next week.

  1. Support for collection of data since the deployment of the smart contracts.
  2. Support for other Ethereum testnets: Ropsten, Goerli, and Kovan.
  3. Screen for showing more information about a wallet that interacts with your dApp.
  4. Show daily highlights to product managers about how users are interacting with the dApp.
  5. Generate weekly/monthly protocol reports.
  6. Support for dApp AARRR funnel: Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Revenue, Referral.
  7. Support for tracking protocol revenue and wallet churn rate.

Spock needs your feedback to improve more. Visit spockanalytics.xyz and use our free interactable demo and provide us with your feedback at hello@spockanalytics.xyz.
